content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
--------------------
No structures have been successfully placed on the map. Although several steps attempted to craft and place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), all such efforts failed due to inventory and resource issues. The agent did interact with existing resource‐processing facilities (for example, a furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) used for iron smelting and a furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0) used for copper smelting), but these were retrieved from the environment rather than constructed.

ERROR TIPS
----------
• API Usage Errors  
  - When invoking get_entities, ensure the function signature is followed. Avoid using unexpected keyword arguments (such as “radius”) and supplying extraneous positional arguments.

• Inventory and Placement Verification  
  - Confirm that the necessary item (e.g., Lab) exists in the inventory before attempting to place it. Use pre-placement checks to verify resource availability.

• Handling None-type Returns  
  - Check for None when processing the results of functions like get_entities. Default to an empty list if no entities are returned to avoid iteration errors.

• Resource and Crafting Planning  
  - For complex recipes (such as Lab crafting), pre-calculate required sub-ingredients (iron‑gear-wheel, electronic-circuit, copper‑cable, etc.) and ensure production chains are in place. Supplement resource production (through smelting or otherwise) to meet these prerequisites before initiating crafting.

• Comprehensive Error Handling  
  - Group similar issues—such as API misuse, inventory shortages, and resource insufficiencies—and implement early validation steps to prevent cascading failures in subsequent operations.
